author: Sharon Profis
title: CNET How To is hiring savvy Smart Home writers!
text:
CNET How To is looking for a weekly contributor to write about Smart Home tips, life hacks, and tutorials. If you know tech, have plenty of great ideas, and are interested in sharing ways to efficiently (and creatively) run a home, we want you on our team. Here are some topic areas you'll cover:
Life hacks : Unexpected tricks for getting things done. i.e. Little-known ways to lower your electricity bill, laundry hacks (like making your own dryer sheets), unexpected uses for smart home devices. Smart Home tutorials : Getting the most out of smart home devices, like smart light bulbs, thermostats, small appliances, and any other products we review at CNET Appliances. Kitchen tips : Hacks, little-known tricks, and must-haves for the home cook. i.e. Tips for using a slow cooker, Make a DIY smoker, Keeping your small appliances in tip-top shape. What you'll do:
Write and publish 5 posts a week (blog posts or galleries) Research and pitch ideas on a weekly basis Write engaging headlines Shoot your own captivating photos using a dSLR (or similar) camera Publish content using our CMS Work remotely Must-haves:
You're a great photographer who knows what works on social media You must be able to write clear, colorful, high-quality prose carefully checked for accuracy Bonus haves: A strong social media following; you enjoy sharing your content with your followers; you can use a photo-editing program If interested, please send your resume, links to at least five writing samples, a few photos, plus a few words about why you want to write for CNET, to sharon.profis@cbsinteractive.com, with How-To Freelancer: Your Name in the subject line.
